data.title: Make Outdated extensions prominent in the Extensions view

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.14.2
- OS Version: win7x64

Steps to Reproduce:

You have 3 extensions to update, I click on a button and..... I see no extensions to update. First I thought it's a bug. But then I noticed (looking at tiny 12), that I have already installed 12 extensions, and the problem in this "Recommended list of whatever", that covers a half of whole extensions area.

Well, guys, that's confusing and annoying! If some genius in VS Code dev team decided to add this "recommended list of some annoying stuff", why he or she didn't think about showing a scroll bar BY DEFAULT in "Installed exts list"? Is it so hard? Why was it so necessary to make a list of "recommended exts" to cover half height of whole extensions area? If it's only, by the way, 5 extensions there you have to recommend me to install.

If you will look at screenshot, and you don't remember how many of exts you have already installed, doesn't it look like you installed only 7 exts? And only super-extra-tiny number 12 will remind you, that you have installed 12 exts, and that you should scroll list a little bit down.

You just should find a way to fix this confusing UI component.

Thanks.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24613274/29145546-4ec32c40-7d66-11e7-9296-2e735f7a04f2.png)

data.title: Fix onDidChangeTextEditorSelection firing when the editor is resized
data.body:
**Bug**
`onDidChangeTextEditorSelection` is being fired when the editor window is resized. This does not seem correct since the selection has not actually changed

**Fix**
Make sure we do not refire this event if the selection as not changed

Fixes #32092

data.title: vscode should not try to contact the internet when computer is disconnected
data.body:
_From @aybabtme on August 9, 2017 18:54_

When I go offline, on planes or whatever, I want to be able to use my editor without issues. Currently, parts of VS Code appear to be trying to check for upgrades or things like that, and does so even when my wifi is completely off. When those upgrades fail, it shows pops up that are distracting.

VS Code should detect that there's no connectivity and avoid spamming user with connection error messages.

_Copied from original issue: Microsoft/vscode-go#1137_

data.title: Why do Windows .zip builds include "win32" in the filename?
data.body:
Installer: VSCodeSetup-x64-1.14.2.exe
.zip: VSCode-**win32**-x64-1.14.2.zip
32-bit Installer: VSCodeSetup-ia32-1.14.2.exe
32-bit .zip: VSCode-**win32**-ia32-1.14.2.zip

This may cause users to be confused as to whether they are installing a 32-bit or 64-bit build.

Should the .zip file names also start with "VSCodeSetup"? 
VSCodeSetup-{bitness}-{version}.zip where the only change between installer and .zip is the file extension

data.title: [ Feature Request ] Previous and Next buttons / Tabs to switch terminals

Hi ! It would be more easy for us to switch between terms via two buttons instead of a selector list
Even better, we could wave a tab for each term and the ability to switch between them by click & prev/next shortcuts

Thanks team !

data.title: Syntax tokenizer errors out on CentOS 6.6
data.body:
- VSCode Version: code-stable-code_1.14.2-1500506907_amd64.tar.g
- OS Version: CentOS 6.6

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Untar vs-code
2. code
3. Ctrl-,

Then the following message appears "Error: the mode has failed while tokenizing the input".  Screenshot:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1714451/29125800-a93e9aa0-7cea-11e7-88d0-da8c379a6785.png)


In the xterm, I get the following:

```xterm
WARNING: Promise with no error callback:6
{ exception: Error: net::ERR_NAME_NOT_RESOLVED,
  error: null,
  promise: 
   { _creator: null,
     _nextState: null,
     _state: 
      { name: 'error',
        enter: [Function: enter],
        cancel: [Function: s],
        done: null,
        then: null,
        _completed: [Function: s],
        _error: [Function: s],
        _notify: [Function: m],
        _progress: [Function: s],
        _setCompleteValue: [Function: s],
        _setErrorValue: [Function: s] },
     _listeners: null,
     _value: Error: net::ERR_NAME_NOT_RESOLVED,
     _isException: true,
     _errorId: 6,
     done: [Function: done],
     then: [Function: then] },
  handler: undefined,
  id: 6,
  parent: undefined }
Error: net::ERR_NAME_NOT_RESOLVED
[uncaught exception in main]: Error: net::ERR_NAME_NOT_RESOLVED

Error: net::ERR_NAME_NOT_RESOLVED
Error: net::ERR_NAME_NOT_RESOLVED

Error: net::ERR_NAME_NOT_RESOLVED
    at Timeout._onTimeout (/home/hertz/a/RedHatEnterpriseWorkstation6.4/VSCode-linux-x64/resources/app/out/vs/code/electron-main/main.js:4:78286)
    at ontimeout (timers.js:365:14)
    at tryOnTimeout (timers.js:237:5)
    at Timer.listOnTimeout (timers.js:207:5)
```

Reproduces without extensions: Yes

The issue was originally reported to the [julia-vscode extension](https://github.com/JuliaEditorSupport/julia-vscode/issues/248) but was found to be unrelated to it.  Linking it here for cross-reference.

data.title: Make Horizontal Slider Taller
data.body:
**Feature Request:** 
- Make horizontal scroll bar taller

**Current:**
- OS Version: Max OSX Sierra
(Light Grey Bar)
![screen shot](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26657360/29128017-7f4d8a3e-7cd7-11e7-92b0-829d28a7a30c.png)

**Reasoning**
At the moment, it is only a 'few pixels' tall, and can take a second to grab to make sure a file isn't pulled off instead. This can really slow down productivity, especially if you have many files open on a small screen and need to constantly switch between them.

data.title: Not intuitive behavior of showInputBox
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.14.2
  - OS Version: macOS 10.12.6 (MacBook Pro, 13-inch, Early 2015)

Reproduces without extensions: Yes

### Current behavior:
  
  0. Create simple `showInputBox`:

  ```js
  export function promptFileName(filename: string) {
      return vscode.window.showInputBox({
          placeHolder: 'Enter the new path for the duplicate.',
          value: filename + '-copy'
      });
  }
  ```

  1. Press <kbd>Right</kbd> button – nothing
  2. Press <kbd>Left</kbd> button – set cursor to the input box (left side)

### Expected behavior:

  1. Press <kbd>Right</kbd> button – set cursor to the input box (right side)

- VSCode Version: Code 1.14.2 (cb82febafda0c8c199b9201ad274e25d9a76874e, 2017-07-19T23:22:50.650Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.7.0
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
EditorConfig|Edi|0.9.4
vscode-docker|Pet|0.0.16
vscode-eslint|dba|1.2.11
tslint|eg2|0.17.0
prettier-vscode|esb|0.22.1
Go|luk|0.6.63
csharp|ms-|1.11.0
sublime-keybindings|ms-|2.9.1
vscode-icons|rob|7.12.0
sass-indented|rob|1.4.1
vscode-coverage-gutters|rya|1.1.1

(2 theme extensions excluded)


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Set up a folder structure as outlined in the screenshot.
2. Use the following jsconfig:
```json
{
  "compilerOptions": {
    "experimentalDecorators": true,
    "baseUrl": "./",
    "module": "es6",
    "paths": {
      "features/*": ["src/client/features/*"],
      "components/*": ["src/client/components/*"],
    }
  }
}
```

3. Try to get autocompletion for the path aliases.

Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Feature request: show the last part of the working directory in terminal title
data.body:
A new feature was just added that shows the current process name inside the terminal name, like `node` instead of simply `cmd.exe`.

While it's a good thing, I think it could be improved even more by adding the current terminal working directory, or at least the *last part* of the working directory.

Right now, if you start two webpack watches, in a two different directories `c:\dev\project1` & `c:\dev\project2`, you will end up with this:

```
1: node
2: node
```

If there was a way to get the last part of the current working directory, it could look like:

```
1: node <projet1>
2: node <project2>
```

Which I find a lot better. This may not be that easy to do on Windows though.

data.title: iOS VSCode (iPad pro) i know it was discussed several times, but is it even potentially possible?
data.body:
I love VSCode with all of my heart. I'm using it for everything but exclusively I'm using it for TypeScript coding.

Right now there are no official apps from IDE giants (jetbrains, microsoft) for iOS (by iOS I mean iPad 
(likely) with keyboard).

There are 10.5 and 12.9 iPads now. And as I can guess with iOS 11 there are much more possibilities to develop "proish" apps.
And right now there are several so-so apps for coding on ipads.

I mean I think it's one part of the future - coding on the go with tablet which works fast, stable and has a nice screen and can have a keyboard to be attached and used. Need more screen? Attach monitor or connect to it wireless.

And I think VSCode has huge part of such future and in general VSCode has potential to become (if it's not yet) one of the best IDEs for web+ development.

If it's not possible now, what can be changed in community, or numbers of coders with iPads or maybe some restrictions on iOS which can be removed?

data.title: Context-aware intellisense
data.body:
Atom's autocomplete-plus has a feature which allows sorting suggestions by a "locality bonus", meaning that symbols in the document that are closer to the cursor are more likely to show up first.

For example, when I type "req" in a node file, the first thing that shows up is "requestAnimationFrame", when I usually want "require" instead. With this "locality bonus", "require" would end up being the first thing to show up, since it's found in the current file already, and probably only a line higher or lower. "requestAnimationFrame" would get pushed lower, since it's not in the file at all.

Apologies in advance if this is a duplicate, or if it's already implemented. I've searched and haven't seen any issue touching particularly on context awareness. It's one of the few features I miss from Atom.
